Authentication Module¶

Module that manage the authentication service, both custom and social-based

Models¶

class app_auth.models.CustomUser(*args, **kwargs)¶

Temporary resource used only during the process of social authentication

Username :username chosen by the user
Email :email chosen by the user
Last_login :last time the user was logged
is_authenticated()¶

Check if the user is authenticated

Returns:True if the user is authenticated
class app_auth.models.CustomUserManager¶

Manager for the CustomUser

create_user(username, email)¶

Retrieve the username and create the user

Parameters:
  • username (str) – the username chosen by the user
  • email (str) – email of the user (unused)

Pipeline¶

app_auth.pipeline.email(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Retrieve the email chosen by the user and update the corresponding auth.User()

app_auth.pipeline.redirect_to_ask_email(*args, **kwargs)¶

If there isn’t a saved email in session, check if the active user has an email. If not, then redirect him to views.ask_email()

app_auth.pipeline.redirect_to_ask_username(*args, **kwargs)¶

If there isn’t a user in session, then redirect to views.ask_username()

app_auth.pipeline.update_name(*args, **kwargs)¶

At the end of the pipeline, check if the connected account has defined a name. If yes, copy it into the corresponding app_users.models.UserProfile

app_auth.pipeline.username(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Retrieve the username chosen by the user

Views¶

app_auth.views.ask_email(request, params=None)¶

When creating a new user through a social login, ask the email to user

Rest Types:GET
Url :ask_email/
app_auth.views.ask_username(request, params=None)¶

When creating a new user through a social login, ask the username to user

Rest Types:GET
Url :ask_username/
app_auth.views.associate(request, backend)¶

Associate an account to a Social Network account

Parameters:backend – the name of social network to connect
Rest Types:GET
Url :associate/(?P<backend>[^/]+)/
app_auth.views.home(request)¶

Render the homepage

Rest Types:GET
Url :/
app_auth.views.login(request)¶

Login the user and redirect him to the homepage

Rest Types:GET
Url :login/
app_auth.views.login_error(request)¶

Return an error page for errors during login

Rest Types:GET
Url :login/error/
app_auth.views.logout(request)¶

Logout the user and redirect him to the homepage

Rest Types:GET
Url :logout/
app_auth.views.password_change_done(request)¶

Confirm a change of password

Rest Types:GET
Url :password/change/done/
